column4: Does anyone know how I can uninstall my wireless card from Ubuntu so that it can detect it again?
fesity
propriety drivers?
I have feisty..
no proprietary drivers. just one integrated broadcom 4313.
you remember which package you installed to get the wireless working?
none, fiesty prompted me to download th efirmware and set it up automatically.
Try System>Administration>Restricted Manager, is anything listed there?
nope, supposedly it's not integrated into ubuntu. No restricted drivers necessary.
nope, supposedly it's noW integrated into ubuntu. No restricted drivers necessary.
is it as easy as rebooting with it disabled in the bios, rinse wash and repeat?
I think if I do that it will just reuse the previous config.

try searching in synaptic with the term "wireless" in Description, than sort the packages by the first field (installed-not installed, the green thing) and look at all the installed packages, maybe you shall find your wireless driver package there, then right-click and complete removal, select OK, and reboot
ok.. cool, I'll try that!
you do realize that rebooting will disconnect me from IRC, right? :-p
is that so?
it still doesn't work... Any ideas?
none whatsoever, i was shooting in the dark
damn.. I heard people die that way. :-)
they surely do but WHY THE HELL are they standing in the dark?
maybe light is to overrated?
